t: Mark 4
Parable of the Sower and Soils
He*p began to teach again by the sea. And such a very large crowd gathered to Him that He got into a boat in the sea and sat down; and the whole crowd was by the sea on the land.
And He was teaching them many things in parables, and was saying to them in His teaching,
“Listen*r to*ir this!*ir Behold,*r the*r sower*r went*r out*r to*r sow;*r
as*r he*r was*r sowing,*r some*r seed*ir fell*r beside*r the*r road,*r and*r the*r birds*r came*r and*r ate*r it*r up.*r
Other*r seed*ir fell*r on*r the*r rocky*r ground*ir where*r it*r did*r not*r have*r much*r soil;*r and*r immediately*r it*r sprang*r up*r because*r it*r had*r no*r depth*r of*r soil.*r
And*r after*r the*r sun*r had*r risen,*r it*r was*r scorched;*r and*r because*r it*r had*r no*r root,*r it*r withered*r away.*r
Other*r seed*ir fell*r among*r the*r thorns,*r and*r the*r thorns*r came*r up*r and*r choked*r it,*r and*r it*r yielded*r no*r crop.*r
Other*r seeds*ir fell*r into*r the*r good*r soil,*r and*r as*r they*r grew*r up*r and*r increased,*r they*r yielded*r a*r crop*r and*r produced*r thirty,*r sixty,*r and*r a*r hundredfold.”*r
And He was saying, “He*r who*r has*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear.”*r
As*p soon as He was alone, His followers, along with the twelve, began*i asking Him about*i the parables.
And He was saying to them, “To*r you*r has*r been*r given*r the*r mystery*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God,*r but*r those*r who*r are*r outside*r get*r everything*r in*r parables,*r

so*r that*r while*sr seeing,*sr they*sr may*sr see*sr and*sr not*sr perceive,*sr and*sr while*sr hearing,*sr they*sr may*sr hear*sr and*sr not*sr understand,*sr otherwise*sr they*sr might*sr return*sr and*sr be*sr forgiven.”*sr
Explanation
And*p He said to them, “Do*r you*r not*r understand*r this*r parable?*r How*r will*r you*r understand*r all*r the*r parables?*r
The*r sower*r sows*r the*r word.*r

These*r are*r the*r ones*r who*r are*r beside*r the*r road*r where*r the*r word*r is*r sown;*r and*r when*r they*r hear,*r immediately*r Satan*r comes*r and*r takes*r away*r the*r word*r which*r has*r been*r sown*r in*r them.*r
In*r a*r similar*r way*r these*r are*r the*r ones*r on*r whom*r seed*r was*r sown*r on*r the*r rocky*r places,*ir who,*r when*r they*r hear*r the*r word,*r immediately*r receive*r it*r with*r joy;*r

and*r they*r have*r no*r firm*ir root*r in*r themselves,*r but*r are*r only*ir temporary;*r then,*r when*r affliction*r or*r persecution*r arises*r because*r of*r the*r word,*r immediately*r they*r fall*r away.*r
And*r others*r are*r the*r ones*r on*r whom*r seed*r was*r sown*r among*r the*r thorns;*r these*r are*r the*r ones*r who*r have*r heard*r the*r word,*r

but*r the*r worries*r of*r the*r world,*r and*r the*r deceitfulness*r of*r riches,*r and*r the*r desires*r for*r other*r things*r enter*r in*r and*r choke*r the*r word,*r and*r it*r becomes*r unfruitful.*r

And*r those*r are*r the*r ones*r on*r whom*r seed*r was*r sown*r on*r the*r good*r soil;*r and*r they*r hear*r the*r word*r and*r accept*r it*r and*r bear*r fruit,*r thirty,*r sixty,*r and*r a*r hundredfold.”*r

And*p He was saying to them, “A*r lamp*r is*r not*r brought*r to*r be*r put*r under*r a*r basket,*r is*r it,*r or*r under*r a*r bed?*r Is*r it*r not*r brought*ir to*r be*r put*r on*r the*r lampstand?*r
For*r nothing*r is*r hidden,*r except*r to*r be*r revealed;*r nor*r has*r anything*ir been*r secret,*r but*r that*r it*r would*r come*r to*r light.*r
If*r anyone*r has*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear.”*r
And He was saying to them, “Take*r care*r what*r you*r listen*r to.*r By*r your*r standard*r of*r measure*r it*r will*r be*r measured*r to*r you;*r and*r more*r will*r be*r given*r you*r besides.*r
For*r whoever*r has,*r to*r him*r more*ir shall*r be*r given;*r and*r whoever*r does*r not*r have,*r even*r what*r he*r has*r shall*r be*r taken*r away*r from*r him.”*r
Parable of the Seed
And*p He was saying, “The*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r like*r a*r man*r who*r casts*r seed*r upon*r the*r soil;*r
and*r he*r goes*r to*r bed*r at*r night*r and*r gets*r up*r by*r day,*r and*r the*r seed*r sprouts*r and*r grows—how,*r he*r himself*r does*r not*r know.*r
The*r soil*r produces*r crops*r by*r itself;*r first*r the*r blade,*r then*r the*r head,*r then*r the*r mature*r grain*r in*r the*r head.*r
But*r when*r the*r crop*r permits,*r he*r immediately*r puts*r in*r the*r sickle,*r because*r the*r harvest*r has*r come.”*r
Parable of the Mustard Seed
And*p He said, “How*r shall*r we*r picture*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God,*r or*r by*r what*r parable*r shall*r we*r present*r it?*r
It*ir is*ir like*r a*r mustard*r seed,*r which,*r when*r sown*r upon*r the*r soil,*r though*r it*r is*r smaller*r than*r all*r the*r seeds*r that*r are*r upon*r the*r soil,*r

yet*r when*r it*r is*r sown,*r it*r grows*r up*r and*r becomes*r larger*r than*r all*r the*r garden*r plants*r and*r forms*r large*r branches;*r so*r that*r the*sr birds*sr of*sr the*sr air*sr can*r nest*sr under*sr its*sr shade.”*sr
With*p many such parables He was speaking the word to them, so far as they were able to hear it;
and He did not speak to them without a parable; but He was explaining everything privately to His own disciples.
Jesus Stills the Sea
On*p that day, when evening came, He said to them, “Let*r us*r go*r over*r to*r the*r other*r side.”*r
Leaving the crowd, they took Him along with them in the boat, just as He was; and other boats were with Him.
And there arose a fierce gale of wind, and the waves were breaking over the boat so much that the boat was already filling up.
Jesus Himself was in the stern, asleep on the cushion; and they woke Him and said to Him, “Teacher, do You not care that we are perishing?”
And He got up and rebuked the wind and said to the sea, “Hush,*r be*r still.”*r And the wind died down and it became perfectly calm.
And He said to them, “Why*r are*r you*r afraid?*r Do*r you*r still*r have*r no*r faith?”*r
They became very much afraid and said to one another, “Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey Him?”
